children.name: Antilock Brake Warning
children.detail:
The ABS light is tied into the antilock brake system.
When functioning correctly, the system helps to reduce stopping distance and maintain control of the vehicle in emergencies.

faq.question: Is it safe to drive with this light on?
faq.answer: In most cases, yes.If the light remains on, it would be safe to get an inspection.

faq.question: What to do if my Brake System lights are on?
faq.answer: Drive cautiously. If you need to make an immediate stop while travelling at medium to high speeds, your ABS may or may not assist you in stopping or maintaining control of your vehicle during the stop.You may want to get this problem resolved as soon as possible, since other safety systems in your vehicle may depend on your ABS system.

faq.question: What causes this?
faq.answer: This could be your emergency brake, loss of brake fluid/pressure, or bad hydraulic valves.

children.name: Battery-Check-Light
children.detail: The Battery warning will come on when the charging system isn't working. This could involve the batter or alternator.

faq.question: If the light stays on, what's wrong?
faq.answer: Most common problem will come from a broken alternator belt.

faq.question: Is it safe to drive with this light on?
faq.answer: This could be dangerous.

faq.question: What should I do if I see this light on?
faq.answer:
If you have no experience in troubleshooting your vehicle, stop at a safe location and call for help immediately.
Here are a few steps you can take to troubleshoot your battery:
Turn off or disconnect all electricity dependent components. This includes: Air conditioning and heating system, Stereo, Interior lights, Heated seats, and Charging accessories. You do not have to turn off your headlights. If the battery light is still on, this means there is enough battery left to continue driving, but only for a short amount of time. You should get this problem checked as soon as you can, if you want to continue driving.
Stop your vehicle. If you notice the engine temperature getting warming or overheating, stop your vehicle in a safe location to prevent any damage that may occur to your engine. Try starting your vehicle, if the battery light turns on again, do not drive. Shut off the engine and find an expert.

children.name: Engine Warning
children.detail:
This light will appear when there is a problem in the electronic-control system.
A red or blinking engine light will require a check or maintenance.

faq.question: Is it safe to drive with this light on?
faq.answer: This is not recommended. Some steps you can take is to look for a serious problem, tightening you gas cap, reduce your speed and load, and use your vehicle's diagnostic services.

faq.question: What causes this?
faq.answer: Faulty MAF sensor, gas cap, faulty battery, contaminated air filter, etc.

faq.question: What to do when your Check Engine light turns on?
faq.answer:
Check for other dashboard lights that may be on such as low oil pressure or overheating. Under these conditions, you should pull over to a safe place, shut off the engine, and call for an expert.
Check if the gas cap is correctly tightened. This can often solve the problem but takes several trips before the light turns off.
If you notice any changes in your vehicle’s performance such as a loss of power, you should reduce your speed and reduce the load on the engine.

children.name: Brake System Warning
children.detail: This warning can show continuously, or when you apply brakes.

faq.question: Is it safe to drive with this light on?
faq.answer: This could be dangerous and it is not recommended.

faq.question: What causes this?
faq.answer: It could mean that hydraulic pressure has been lost or that the fluid level in the master cylinder is dangerously low. This could be due to a leak. A leak will not allow you to stop your car safely.

faq.question: What to do when your Brake light turns on?
faq.answer:
Check to see if your parking/emergency brake is correctly disengaged. Most vehicles will turn on its brake system warning light if a driver forgets to disengage their parking/emergency brake.
If this does not solve the issue, arrange to have your vehicle safely transported to an expert as soon as possible.If the light turns on while you are driving, slowly brake and stop at a safe location. Once you are stopped call for assistance to have your vehicle transported to a repair shop.

children.name: Low Oil Warning
children.detail: This is a warning that there is not enough oil pressure or that your oil levels are too low.

faq.question: Can I just add more oil?
faq.answer: This might be a temporary fix, but burning oil or oil leaks might still be happening.

faq.question: What to do when your Engine Oil Warning light turns on?
faq.answer:
If the light is yellow, plan on getting your oil changed soon.
If the light is red, safely stop operation of the vehicle as soon as possible, and turn off the engine.It is dangerous to continue driving.
If you do not have experience checking your oil levels, call for assistance immediately.If you have experience checking your oil, check to see if it is low. You will need to add more oil if this is the case.
If you are unable to add more oil, call for assistance.If you’ve added more oil and the light is still on, call for assistance immediately. It is dangerous to drive.

children.name: Low Fuel Warning
children.detail: This is a common light letting you know you need more fuel. Some cars will show you your remaining range in miles or kilometers.

faq.question: Is it safe to drive with this light on?
faq.answer:
For a little while, yes. Avoid long journeys. Try to find a gas station as soon as you can.
Turn off your Air conditioning as the system operates on gas. Doing this will help you save fuel in most situations.
In addition, try to reduce your braking and refrain from accelerating rapidly if you do not need to.
If you do not think you can make it to a gas station before your fuel runs out, stop your car at a safe location and call for assistance.

faq.question: How much fuel is left?
faq.answer: This varies with make and model.

faq.question: Does low fuel damage the car?
faq.answer: With a very low fuel level, you can damage your fuel pump.

children.name: Low Wiper Fluid Warning
children.detail: This light indicates that your level of windshild washer fluid is low and that you should add some to the tank as soon as possible.

faq.question: Is it safe to drive with this light on?
faq.answer: It's not recommended to do that.

faq.question: What to do when your Low Wiper Fluid light turns on?
faq.answer:
Adding/replacing the fluid is recommended as it prevents seals in the fluid system from drying up and leaking.
Usually when a driver needs to use their wipers, it is because they really need to use them. It is recommended to keep your wiper fluid as full as possible

children.name: Temperature Warning
children.detail: The temperature warning light indicates that your engine is overheating or running too hot and is causing the cooling system to heat up. This light will show as blue if the engine is not warmed up yet and is below its optimal temperature.

faq.question: Is it safe to drive with this light on?
faq.answer: It's not recommended to do that.

faq.question: What to do when your Temperature Warning light turns on?
faq.answer:
If the light is blue, you can still operate your vehicle normally. Though it is best to wait till it disappears. The blue light should disappear once your engine reaches its optimal temperature. The light will usually be blue if it is cold outside.
If the light is blinking, decelerate your vehicle.
If the blinking light turns off, you can drive your vehicle normally.
If the problem persists, call for assistance as soon as possible.If the light is illuminated for longer than a few seconds, your engine may overheat. Safely stop operation of the vehicle and call for assistance as soon as possible.
If the light is blinking alternately, call for assistance as soon as possible.

children.name: Tire Pressure Warning
children.detail: The tire pressure light indicates that one of your tires has dangerously low pressure. Depending on your vehicle, each tire needs a certain amount of pressure for optimal operation. Tires affect the speed, acceleration, cornering, and stopping of your vehicle. This requires immediate attention.

faq.question: Is it safe to drive with this light on?
faq.answer: It's not recommended to do that.

faq.question: What to do when your Tire Pressure Warning light turns on?
faq.answer:
Safely stop the vehicle and check if you have a flat tire.
If one of your tires is flat or punctured, you will need to get it changed. If you do not know how to change your tire, or do not have the means to do so, call for help immediately.If you are sure that you do not have a flat or punctured tire, check if any of your tires are dangerously low in pressure.
If you do not visually see any issues, drive safely to the nearest tire shop, or repair shop to fill up your tires. Gas stations will usually have a self-service station that allows you to fill up your tires for a small price. Make sure to check all your tires.
If you do not know how to do this yourself, calling for assistance or going to a service shop is highly recommended.

children.name: Traction Control Indicator
children.detail: The traction control system (TCS) is responsible for helping your vehicle maintain its grip in situations where your tires may slip. The TCS works together with your anti-lock braking system(ABS) to provide safety.

faq.question: Is it safe to drive with this light on?
faq.answer: It's not recommended to do that.

faq.question: What to do when your Traction Control light turns on?
faq.answer:
If this light is on, it usually means that the TCS is in operation. It may also blink while working.
If you are in normal, non-slippery driving conditions and the light illuminates, there may be a problem with the system. This usually occurs with a faulty sensor used by the TCS or ABS systems. When this occurs, stop at a safe location, turn off your vehicle, and restart your vehicle. If the light is still illuminated, call an expert for a diagnosis and repair when you can. You will be able to drive, but please proceed cautiously.
If both the TCS and ABS lights are illuminated along with your brake system lights, call for help immediately.

children.name: Cruise Control Indicator
children.detail: This light indicates that cruise control is turned on. Cruise control automatically controls the speed of your vehicle. Every vehicle will vary in the way that cruise control is activated. Most vehicles will require you to press the “CRUISE” button on your steering wheel and accelerate to your desired speed before pressing the button again to activate cruise control.

faq.question: What to do when Cruise Control is on?
faq.answer: If you would like to deactivate cruise control, simply pressing on the break or changing your speed will deactivate it.

children.name: Ignition Switch Warning
children.detail: This light indicates that there is a malfunction in the ignition system. This is the system that allows you to turn your engine on and off.

faq.question: What to do when your Ignition Switch light turns on?
faq.answer: Check your ignition switch, where you insert your key to turn on the engine, for dirt and grime that may be stuck.If the light is yellow, please see an expert for a diagnosis.If the light is red, do not turn off your car. Drive home or to a repair shop immediately as you may not be able to turn your car on again until it is fixed

children.name: Steering Lock Warning
children.detail: This light indicates that there is a fault with your steering lock. The steering lock is an anti-theft device that stops someone who doesn’t have the key from taking your car. Notice that you can not move the wheel when the ignition is off.

faq.question: What to do when your Steering Lock Warning light turns on?
faq.answer:
If this light is yellow, get this problem repaired as soon as possible.
If the light turns red while you are driving, stop in a safe location and call for assistance immediately. The wheel could lock while you are moving and prevent you from turning.

children.name: Door open Warning
children.detail: This light will vary from vehicle to vehicle, but the concept is the same. This light indicates that one of the doors in your vehicle is not close properly. The light will usually show which door is not closed. Before continuing to drive, please check that all of your doors are properly closed.

faq.question: What to do when your Door open Warning light turns on?
faq.answer:
Check your doors to make sure they are properly closed. This may involve opening and closing each door, including the trunk.
If the problem persists, it is usually safe to drive as long as you have checked that all doors have been closed. If your interior car lights remain turned on, this may cause more problems, as it is illegal to do so in certain areas. Locate a repair shop for service as soon as you can if the problem persists.

children.name: SeatBelt Warning
children.detail: The seatbelt warning light indicates that the driver does not have their seatbelt on securely. Fastening your seatbelt should make the light go away. If you’ve made sure it is fastened, but theproblem persists, your vehicle’s drivability will not be affected but your safety might be at risk. Seek assistance as soon as you can, and drive with caution.

faq.question: What to do when your SeatBelt Warning light turns on?
faq.answer:
Make sure your seatbelt is fastened. If it is already fastened, try unfastening and refastening it to see if the warning goes away. Also check for debris that may be interfering inside the buckle.If the light does not go away, there are wires under your seat that are attached to this system. Try moving your seat back and forth if possible.
If this does not help, try to check if all the wires are firmly connected. Be sure to check the passenger seat if the problem persists.
If any of the previous steps do not help, find a nearby repair shop.

children.name: Rotten eggs
children.detail: If your vehicle smells of rotten eggs, it is probably coming from your transmission. Your transmission uses oil containing sulfur, which is what produces the smell. The smell of rotten eggs can also mean you have a problem with your catalytic converter.

faq.question: Should I drive after I smell some rotten-eggs like odor?
faq.answer: We suggest you don't do that.

faq.question: What to do when you smell some rotten-eggs like odor?
faq.answer: Go to your nearest repair shop as soon as you can.

children.name: Gasoline
children.detail: If you smell any type of gasoline from the inside of your car, it usually means something is wrong with your fuel-tank injection line or vent hose.

faq.question: What to do when you smell some gasoline scent?
faq.answer: Go to your nearest repair shop as soon as you can.

children.name: Burnt
children.detail:
The smell of burning paper is most likely coming from your clutch, which is in charge of helping your car shift gears.
A burnt carpet smell usually arises when the brake pads are overheated.

faq.question: What to do when you smell some burnt scent?
faq.answer: Go to your nearest repair shop as soon as you can.

children.name: Mold
children.detail: If your vehicle smells moldy, it probably is. There may be mildew growing inside your air conditioning system from moisture.

faq.question: What to do when you smell some mold scent?
faq.answer: A possible solution is to turn your air conditioning off and run the fan on high to dry the system out. Go to the nearest repair shop or contact an expert for assistance if this does not solve the issue.

children.name: Maple Syrup
children.detail: If your vehicle smells sweet after the engine has been running, you may have a coolant leak. This may be coming from the radiator, heater, failed intake gasket or cylinder head. If it seems like the odor is coming from the glove/passenger compartment, the issue may be from your heater.

faq.question: What to do when you smell some mold scent?
faq.answer: Go to the nearest repair shop or contact an expert for assistance if you are unsure of what to do.

children.name: Hot Oil
children.detail: If you smell hot oil, there may be an oil leak.

faq.question: What to do when you smell some mold scent?
faq.answer: Go to the nearest repair shop or contact an expert for assistance if you are unsure of what to do.

children.name: Black Smoke
children.detail: If there is black smoke coming from your exhaust, this indicates that your engine is burning too much fuel. There are multiple other causes to black smoke, such as a broken fuel pressure regulator, leaking fuel injector or dysfunctional carburetor.

faq.question: What should I do if I see black smoke?
faq.answer: Calling an expert or going to a repair shop is recommended if you are unsure of the cause.

children.name: White Smoke
children.detail: White smoke coming from the engine can indicate multiple issues such as a coolant leak, a cracked engine block, or a leaking head gasket.

faq.question: What should I do if I see white smoke?
faq.answer: You will most likely need to stop the operation of your vehicle and call for assistance immediately. Operation of the vehicle may cause overheating.

children.name: Clunking
children.detail: If you hear clunking while braking, your brake caliper may be damaged, broken, or improperly installed.

faq.question: What to do if I hear clunking?
faq.answer: You should call for assistance immediately and refrain from operating your vehicle.

children.name: Flapping
children.detail: Flapping noises may come from a fan or a belt.

faq.question: What to do if I hear flapping?
faq.answer: You should call for assistance immediately.

children.name: Grinding
children.detail: If you hear grinding while speeding up or slowing down, your transmission might have issues.

faq.question: What to do if I hear grinding?
faq.answer: You should call for assistance immediately.

children.name: Sizzling/Hissing
children.detail: Sizzling or hissing may signify a leak of oil or coolant.

faq.question: What to do if I hear sizzling?
faq.answer: You should call for assistance immediately.

children.name: Knocking
children.detail: A knocking sound will usually come from your engine compartment. Make sure that you are using the correct grade of fuel and the correct type of oil for your vehicle.

faq.question: What to do if I hear knocking?
faq.answer: You should call for assistance immediately.

children.name: Bang
children.detail: If you hear a loud bang from the back of your car, this may be caused by a backfire. This occurs when the mixture between the air and your fuel is too rich. There may also be an issue with your catalytic converter.

faq.question: What to do if I hear bang?
faq.answer: You should call for assistance immediately.

children.name: Imbalanced Tires
children.detail: If your vehicle shakes at high speeds, your tires are most likely imbalanced. This is due to your tires wearing unevenly.

faq.question: What should I do if I feel the shake from tire?
faq.answer: To fix this issue, go to a nearby tire or repair shop to have your tires rotated and balanced. If this problem persists, you may need to purchase new tires.

children.name: Spark Plugs
children.detail: Engine shaking is most likely caused by old spark plugs that need replacement. An oil leak may also occur, but there is no need to worry about the oil leak.

faq.question: What should I do?
faq.answer: If replacing the spark plugs stops the shaking, it should also stop the leak. Your vehicle may be drivable, but go to your nearest repair shop for assistance as soon as you can.

children.name: Brake Pads
children.detail: When a vehicle shakes while you are braking, a potential cause are the brake pads being worn out. You should also hear a loud brushing noise if this is the case.

faq.question: What should I do?
faq.answer: To solve this, you should seek assistance from a repair shop to replace your brake pads.

children.name: Brake Calipers
children.detail: Sticky brake calipers can cause a vehicle to shake. This is only the case when your car shakes while driving around 45 mph and up. You should also smell a burning odor which intensifies relative to higher speeds.

faq.question: What should I do?
faq.answer: To solve this, you should seek assistance from a repair shop.

children.name: Axles
children.detail: Damaged axles will cause shaking.

faq.question: What should I do?
faq.answer: replace the axles, Seek assistance from a repair shop to solve this issue.
